content.description: Slick clip the first bolt or climb up to the left and reach out from a good foot hold to make the clip. Smear your way up past the first 2 or 3 bolts more easily and then face a crimpy crux past the 4th bolt. Beyond that the wall steepens and the holds get bigger. What a cool and unlikely place to have a sweet slab climb. It would be possible in parts to stem across or chimney to the wall behind you but I like it best as a pure face/slab route. Do it however you see fit though, it's going to be fun either way and there is unlikely going to be anyone in the cave to judge you for your choices ;)
content.protection: 5 bolts to ring anchor. You may also top out and belay your second from an anchor outside the cave and then rap back down to the main Cavern Cliff area.
content.location: This is the harder (right-hand) of the 2 bolted lines on the slabby wall inside the giant cave.

content.description: This route fulfilled a dream for me. To put up a climb that climbs one wall and then transfers to an opposing wall to finish the climb. Start on easy low angle rock past 3 bolts. Maybe 5.6. stem across the divide and clipped a fixed draw (I left a fixed draw in case you were short on reaching the bolt). It is a good idea to step back down and extend the last draw on the initial wall. Make the transfer to the other side. Climb up placing trad gear under the roof. Move around to the right placing another piece and move back left to the anchor. Lower back down out of the sun and into the void.
content.protection: 4 bolts, trad gear to ring anchors.
content.location: If you are facing the slabby side of the cave this is the left most route. The easier looking line.

content.description: OW/squeeze chimney with a short stemming traverse at the top.  With some OW technique this will go down easily then you'll finish 45/50 feet above the crevasse, straddle either side and pull around right for the top out.
content.protection: Currently no fixed gear or bolts, no way to top rope either, a solo top rope can be set up or it can be free soloed. it will take big bro's and maybe a BD 5 &/or 6.  The moves are all very secure and aside from the stemming exit (5.4ish) it would be unlikely to fall. (use your own judgement a fall here would be awful with no easy way for help to get you out)
content.location: The Gandalf Cave is located on the inside of The Upper Cliff.

content.description: If you enter from the bolder blocked passage, right before you scramble down into the main cave this is a line of least resistance that moves up the chimney and around stuck boulders before you make a horizontal squeeze back into the world of daylight.
content.protection: trad gear. Bolted anchor up and around the corner.
content.location: If you enter from the bolder blocked passage, right before you scramble down into the main cave area this one goes up between the walls and around at least one stuck boulder.

content.description: Can't find the words right now...pretty amazing though. and about the size of a yacht. Jay and I found this while exploring...Thanks to Jay for sharing such a cool spot!This cave is hidden inside Cavern Cliff. It is about 40 feet deep, at least 100 feet wide and only maybe 8 feet across at it's widest. There are a few ways to get into it. You could climb Yellowjacket slab which finishes looking down into the void, and rappel down from a bolted anchor. You may also hike around Cavern Cliff to climbers left and find the entrance blocked by a big boulder. Scramble up carefully and over the boulder and down into the cave.
